arts.ttl: Thibaut Courtois reacts after Real Madrid 1-0 Juventus – ‘I think my best stop was..’
arts.sum: Thibaut Courtois was one of the stars in Real Madrid’s win over Juventus last night as he pulled off some stunning saves to keep Los Blancos in contention and with a clean sheet. His efforts eventually paid off when Jude Bellingham scored and established a lead for Los Blancos, laying the platform for their 1-0 win on the night. arts.ttl: Guler, Tchouameni preview El Clasico after win over Juventus – ‘Doesn’t matter what happened last year’
arts.sum: An all-round performance from Real Madrid saw them secure a 1-0 win over Juventus last night, but the game also exposed some frailties in Xabi Alonso’s system. The Italians put serious pressure on Real Madrid in the first half and created chances in both halves, but Thibaut Courtois kept the team in the game. arts.ttl: Xabi Alonso talks Bellingham, Guler, Courtois, Miliato, El Clasico after Real Madrid 1-0 Juventus
arts.sum: Real Madrid largely dominated their game against Juventus in the UEFA Champions League last night and managed to take away a 1-0 win, thus securing all three points in the gruelling fixture. The Bianconeri were no easy team to get past, but Los Blancos persevered and created multiple chances. Ultimately, it was Jude Bellingham who netted the winner. arts.ttl: Jude Bellingham back in scoring form as Real Madrid edge out Juventus
arts.sum: It wasn’t a classic, but the chorus from the Santiago Bernabéu was. It had been a while and they had missed moments like this, but for the first time since April Fool’s Day Jude Bellingham stood before the south end of this stadium with his arms wide listening to them sing Hey Jude. There had been a shoulder injury, and doubts about his role too, but now he had scored his first goal of the season, ultimately took Real Madrid to a 1-0 win over a Juventus side that aren’t what they once were. With just two points and sitting below the cut, the Italians may yet struggle to progress from the league phase of a competition in which they have played nine finals. They may reflect on a decent start, an exceptional Thibaut Courtois save, a great opportunity wasted on 85 minutes and another save from Courtois in added time. Madrid had lived dangerously at times, but ultimately though had done more, racking up 30 shots and their third win in three. Continue reading...
